name: gittype
description: A CLI code-typing game that turns your source code into typing challenges
readme_summary: GitType is a CLI tool that turns your source code into typing challenges, allowing you to improve your typing skills while familiarizing yourself with your codebase. It supports multiple languages and offers real-time metrics, a ranking system, and various game modes to make code-typing practice engaging and productive.
key_features: Multiple game modes (Normal, Time Attack, custom difficulty)
primary_use_case: Improving typing skills and code familiarity through gamified typing challenges using your own source code.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled typist battling a giant, glitching code monster made of tangled code lines. The typist's keyboard glows with each correct keystroke, weakening the monster. The background shows a subtle cityscape of code, with snippets of various programming languages. Small UI elements display WPM and accuracy scores. The repository name, 'GitType,' is subtly integrated into the cityscape. The scene is set in a dimly lit, futuristic arena with dramatic lighting. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.

name: flint
description: Lightweight tool for managing linux virtual machines
readme_summary: Flint is a lightweight KVM management tool designed for developers, sysadmins, and home labs. It provides a modern web UI, CLI, and API for managing virtual machines, emphasizing ease of use and minimal bloat. It supports features like cloud-init, snapshot-based templates, and secure authentication.
primary_use_case: Managing KVM virtual machines with a focus on simplicity and efficiency.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously assembling a complex clockwork mechanism where each gear represents a virtual machine. The clock face displays various server metrics and statuses. Cloud symbols float around the clock, representing cloud-init integration. The clockmaker uses a set of specialized tools, including a tiny web browser and command-line interface. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, organized workbench. Small UI elements and code snippets are subtly integrated into the clock's design. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: leantime
description: Leantime is a goals focused project management system for non-project managers. Building with ADHD, Autism, and dyslexia in mind.
readme_summary: Leantime is an open-source project management system designed for non-project managers, emphasizing ease of use and accessibility. It combines strategy, planning, and execution features, offering alternatives to tools like Trello, Jira, ClickUp, Monday, and Asana. It includes features for task management, project planning, knowledge management, and administration.
key_features: Task management (Kanban, Gantt, table, list, calendar views)
Project dashboards, reports, and status updates
primary_use_case: Project management for teams, especially those without dedicated project managers, focusing on ease of use and comprehensive feature set.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled navigator charting a course on a vast ocean, representing project goals. The navigator uses various tools – a compass (strategy), a map (planning), and a ship (execution) – to guide their team towards a distant island (project completion). Small screens display Kanban boards and Gantt charts, subtly integrated into the ship's control panel. The scene is set on a clear, sunny day with a sense of adventure and collaboration. The repository name, 'Leantime,' is subtly etched on the ship's hull. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: mobile-use
description: AI agents can now use real Android and iOS apps, just like a human.
readme_summary: Mobile-use is an open-source AI agent that enables natural language control of Android and iOS devices. It allows users to automate tasks, navigate apps, and extract data using natural language commands, effectively bridging the gap between human intention and mobile device interaction.
primary_use_case: Automating tasks on Android and iOS devices using natural language commands.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot butler stands in a futuristic home, effortlessly managing various apps on a holographic phone. The robot is scheduling appointments, ordering groceries, and sending messages, all based on spoken commands. Visual cues like speech bubbles and app icons float around the robot, illustrating its ability to understand and execute tasks. Small UI elements and code snippets subtly appear as part of the holographic display. The scene is brightly lit with a clean, modern aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: streamdown
description: A drop-in replacement for react-markdown, designed for AI-powered streaming.
readme_summary: Streamdown is a TypeScript library that serves as a drop-in replacement for react-markdown, specifically designed for handling streaming Markdown content, particularly from AI models. It excels at gracefully formatting incomplete or unterminated Markdown blocks, making it suitable for real-time content generation and display.
primary_use_case: Rendering streaming Markdown content, especially from AI models, in React applications.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled calligrapher meticulously writing on a scroll that magically extends as they write. The scroll represents streaming Markdown, and the calligrapher's pen emits glowing particles that instantly format the text. The scroll displays various Markdown elements like headings, lists, and code snippets, all perfectly rendered even as the calligrapher continues to write. Small UI elements float nearby, showing a live preview of the formatted Markdown. The scene is set in a bright, airy studio filled with subtle digital accents. The image should be in a clean, flat design style with clear iconography and a harmonious color scheme.

name: ccpm
description: Project management system for Claude Code using GitHub Issues and Git worktrees for parallel agent execution.
readme_summary: The ccpm repository provides a project management system tailored for Claude Code, leveraging GitHub Issues and Git worktrees to enable parallel agent execution. It aims to improve team collaboration, maintain context, and ensure traceability throughout the development process, from PRD creation to production code.
key_features: GitHub Issues integration for task management
primary_use_case: Managing Claude Code projects with parallel AI agent execution and full traceability using GitHub Issues and Git worktrees.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled conductor leading an orchestra of AI agents, each represented by a musical instrument, harmoniously working together on different parts of a complex composition (the software project). The conductor (representing the project manager) uses a digital tablet displaying GitHub Issues to guide the agents. Each instrument's output flows into a central mixing console, transforming individual contributions into a polished symphony (the final product). Subtle UI elements and code snippets float around the scene, connecting the metaphor to software development. The scene is set in a futuristic concert hall with dynamic lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and intricate details.

name: vdu_controls
description: VDU controls - a control panel for monitor brightness/contrast/...
readme_summary: vdu_controls is a Python-based control panel for external monitors (VDUs) connected via DisplayPort, DVI, HDMI, or USB. It allows users to adjust brightness, contrast, and audio, and supports ambient light-based automatic brightness control using hardware light meters or solar-illumination estimation. The application can run in the system tray and adapts to light and dark Qt desktop themes.
key_features: Ambient light-based automatic brightness control (hardware light meter integration)
Presets for different settings (night, day, etc.)
Light and dark Qt desktop theme adaptation
primary_use_case: Controlling external monitor settings (brightness, contrast, audio) and automating brightness adjustments based on ambient light conditions.
cover_image_prompt: An artist sitting at a digital easel, painting light onto a series of monitor screens. The artist holds a palette with colors representing brightness and contrast levels. A light sensor on the artist's desk measures the ambient light, influencing the colors being mixed. The monitor screens display various scenes, subtly adjusting their brightness in response to the artist's actions. Small UI elements float around the easel, showing sliders and preset options. The scene is set in a bright, modern studio with natural lighting. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and vibrant colors.
